trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio in Solution Explorer, right click the service project and click **Start new instance** under the **Debug** context menu.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio in Solution Explorer, right click the service project and click **Start new instance** under the **Debug** context menu.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio opens the default web page for your service.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio opens the default web page for your service.

trans-unit.source: By default, Visual Studio hosts your mobile app backend locally in IIS Express.
trans-unit.target: By default, Visual Studio hosts your mobile app backend locally in IIS Express.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the tray icon for IIS Express on the Windows taskbar and verify that your mobile app backend has started.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the tray icon for IIS Express on the Windows taskbar and verify that your mobile app backend has started.

trans-unit.source: verify the mobile service in the taskbar
trans-unit.target: verify the mobile service in the taskbar

trans-unit.source: On the start page of your .NET backend, click **try it out**.
trans-unit.target: On the start page of your .NET backend, click **try it out**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the API documentation page, which you can use to test the Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: This displays the API documentation page, which you can use to test the Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Authentication is not required to access this page when running locally.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Authentication is not required to access this page when running locally.

trans-unit.source: When running in Azure, you must supply the application key as the password (with no username) to access this page.
trans-unit.target: When running in Azure, you must supply the application key as the password (with no username) to access this page.

trans-unit.source: This displays the GET response page for the API.
trans-unit.target: This displays the GET response page for the API.

trans-unit.source: Click **try this out** and then click **send**.
trans-unit.target: Click **try this out** and then click **send**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a GET request to the local mobile app backend to return all rows in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: This sends a GET request to the local mobile app backend to return all rows in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Because the table is seeded by the initializer, two TodoItem objects are returned in the body of the response message.
trans-unit.target: Because the table is seeded by the initializer, two TodoItem objects are returned in the body of the response message.

trans-unit.source: For more information about initializers, see [How to make data model changes to a .NET backend mobile service](../articles/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-code-first-migrations.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about initializers, see [How to make data model changes to a .NET backend mobile service](../articles/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-code-first-migrations.md).
